articles.headline: How Russian Media Uses Fox News to Make Its Case
articles.snippet: The conservative network has appeared hundreds of times in Russian media.
articles.abstract: The conservative network has appeared hundreds of times in Russian media.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Western leaders introduced sanctions against Russia for the invasion of Ukraine, Tucker Carlson, the Fox News host, said seizing personal property from Russian oligarchs went too far.

articles.headline: ‘Thank You for Not Killing Us’
articles.snippet: An ordeal at a mental health facility in Ukraine illuminated the horrors of the Russian occupation in the areas around Kyiv.
articles.abstract: An ordeal at a mental health facility in Ukraine illuminated the horrors of the Russian occupation in the areas around Kyiv.
articles.lead_paragraph: BORODIANKA, Ukraine — The first sign of trouble was when a squad of Chechen soldiers burst through the gate.
articles.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman, Oleksandr Chubko and David Guttenfelder

articles.headline: Girding for New Battle, Russia Warns U.S. on Advanced Weapons for Ukraine
articles.snippet: The warnings were regarded as a sign that American military assistance to Ukraine was compounding problems for the Russians in their two-month-old invasion.
articles.abstract: The warnings were regarded as a sign that American military assistance to Ukraine was compounding problems for the Russians in their two-month-old invasion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stung by war losses and massing troops for a new battle in eastern Ukraine, Russia has warned the Biden administration to stop supplying advanced weapons to Ukrainian forces or face “unpredictable consequences,” American officials said Friday.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, Helene Cooper and Anton Troianovski

articles.headline: Prized Russian Ship Was Hit by Missiles, U.S. Officials Say
articles.snippet: The sinking of the Moskva was a major blow to the Russian fleet and the most significant combat loss for any navy in decades.
articles.abstract: The sinking of the Moskva was a major blow to the Russian fleet and the most significant combat loss for any navy in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Moskva was the pride of Russia’s Black Sea Fleet, a symbol of the country’s dominance of the region and a powerful war machine that had been used to launch precision cruise missiles deep inside Ukraine.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes and James Glanz

articles.headline: The Unseen Scars of Those Who Kill Via Remote Control
articles.snippet: Capt. Kevin Larson was one of the best drone pilots in the U.S. Air Force. Yet as the job weighed on him and untold others, the military failed to recognize its full impact. He fled into the California wilderness.
articles.abstract: Capt. Kevin Larson was one of the best drone pilots in the U.S. Air Force. Yet as the job weighed on him and untold others, the military failed to recognize its full impact. He fled into the California wilderness.
articles.lead_paragraph: REDWOOD VALLEY, Calif. — After hiding all night in the mountains, Air Force Capt. Kevin Larson crouched behind a boulder and watched the forest through his breath, waiting for the police he knew would come. It was Jan. 19, 2020. He was clinging to an assault rifle with 30 rounds and a conviction that, after all he had been through, there was no way he was going to prison.

articles.headline: Some Care Workers Are Seeing a Bump in Pay. They’re Working to Make It Last.
articles.snippet: Care workers are organizing for better work conditions and to keep pandemic gains going.
articles.abstract: Care workers are organizing for better work conditions and to keep pandemic gains going.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sandra Rosales’s voice takes on an affectionate lilt when she recalls the notes she received from the two girls she used to care for in Brooklyn. “If I had to describe you in one word it would be loving,” one of her nanny charges, now 9, wrote to Ms. Rosales last year. “Thanks for encouraging me to be brave.”

articles.headline: From Her First $100K to 3 Million Followers
articles.snippet: Tori Dunlap’s savings journey turned her into a full-time finfluencer. Her latest partnership aims to help women get together and get started with investing.
articles.abstract: Tori Dunlap’s savings journey turned her into a full-time finfluencer. Her latest partnership aims to help women get together and get started with investing.
articles.lead_paragraph: The women logged on from Alaska, Florida and points in between, excited and nervous. The energy was palpable in the chat stream, which bubbled with the kind of quick and candid confessions that emerge in a room of virtual strangers.

articles.headline: The Sky-High Pandemic Housing Market Finds Gravity Does Exist
articles.snippet: Mortgage costs have jumped as the Federal Reserve has raised rates. With higher rates come fewer offers.
articles.abstract: Mortgage costs have jumped as the Federal Reserve has raised rates. With higher rates come fewer offers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Luis Solis, a real estate agent in Portland, Ore., marked a milestone weekend late last month. It was the first time in two years that one of his listings made it to Monday without any offers.
articles.byline: By Conor Dougherty and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: The Battery That Flies
articles.snippet: A new aircraft being built in Vermont has no need for jet fuel. It can take off and land without a runway. Amazon and the Air Force are both betting on it. So who will be in the cockpit?
articles.abstract: A new aircraft being built in Vermont has no need for jet fuel. It can take off and land without a runway. Amazon and the Air Force are both betting on it. So who will be in the cockpit?
articles.lead_paragraph: Kitty Hawk. The invention of the jet engine. And on a frozen Vermont morning, circling above Lake Champlain, the Alia.
articles.byline: By Ben Ryder Howe and Tristan Spinski

articles.headline: Putin’s Ukraine Gamble Pivots to a Very Different Battlefield
articles.snippet: After Russian forces were mauled in cities and towns in northern Ukraine, Vladimir V. Putin is shifting the focus of his invasion to the flatlands of Donbas, in the east.
articles.abstract: After Russian forces were mauled in cities and towns in northern Ukraine, Vladimir V. Putin is shifting the focus of his invasion to the flatlands of Donbas, in the east.
articles.lead_paragraph: KYIV, Ukraine — There are fields instead of city streets, farmsteads instead of apartment buildings. Open highways stretch to the horizon.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Eric Schmitt, Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Michael Schwirtz

articles.headline: A Russian Default Is Looming. A Bitter Fight Is Likely to Follow.
articles.snippet: The ultimate arbiter of a sovereign default is an open question but markets may have the final word.
articles.abstract: The ultimate arbiter of a sovereign default is an open question but markets may have the final word.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Russia is ambling toward a major default on its foreign debt, a grim milestone that it has not seen since the Bolshevik Revolution more than a century ago and one that raises the prospect of years of legal wrangling and a global hunt by bondholders for Russian assets.

articles.headline: Russia Fires Missile Barrage at Ukrainian Cities and Military Targets
articles.snippet: The strikes seemed aimed at hampering Ukraine’s war fighting capacity as the conflict shifts to eastern Donbas region, and at responding to the sinking of a Russian warship.
articles.abstract: The strikes seemed aimed at hampering Ukraine’s war fighting capacity as the conflict shifts to eastern Donbas region, and at responding to the sinking of a Russian warship.
articles.lead_paragraph: Russia pounded military targets throughout Ukraine on Saturday, in apparent retaliation for the sinking of an important naval ship and in preparation for an offensive in the Donbas region of the country’s east.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Marc Santora and Matina Stevis-Gridneff

articles.headline: The Elusive Politics of Elon Musk
articles.snippet: The billionaire in pursuit of Twitter has often been described as a libertarian, but he has not shrunk from government help when it has been good for business.
articles.abstract: The billionaire in pursuit of Twitter has often been described as a libertarian, but he has not shrunk from government help when it has been good for business.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our live coverage on Elon Musk and Twitter news.

articles.headline: Disney, Built on Fairy Tales and Fantasy, Confronts the Real World
articles.snippet: The entertainment behemoth spent decades avoiding even the whiff of controversy. But it has increasingly been drawn into the partisan political fray.
articles.abstract: The entertainment behemoth spent decades avoiding even the whiff of controversy. But it has increasingly been drawn into the partisan political fray.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: The World’s Broken Promise of Asylum
articles.snippet: Britain’s new plan to send thousands of asylum seekers to Rwanda exposes the fragile nature of the global refugee compact, which has always fallen prey to domestic politics.
articles.abstract: Britain’s new plan to send thousands of asylum seekers to Rwanda exposes the fragile nature of the global refugee compact, which has always fallen prey to domestic politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than 70 years, the world has enshrined, in national laws and global agreements, a promise that was presented as vitally important: Anyone who cannot live safely in their home country may seek refuge in another.

articles.headline: Mar-a-Lago Machine: Trump as a Modern-Day Party Boss
articles.snippet: Hoarding cash, doling out favors and seeking to crush rivals, the former president is dominating the G.O.P., preparing for another race and helping loyalists oust officials who thwarted his attempted subversion of the 2020 election.
articles.abstract: Hoarding cash, doling out favors and seeking to crush rivals, the former president is dominating the G.O.P., preparing for another race and helping loyalists oust officials who thwarted his attempted subversion of the 2020 election.
articles.lead_paragraph: PALM BEACH, Fla. — On any given night, Donald J. Trump will stroll onto the patio at Mar-a-Lago and say a few words from a translucent lectern, welcoming whatever favored candidate is paying him for the privilege of fund-raising there.

articles.headline: Atrocities in Ukraine War Have Deep Roots in Russian Military
articles.snippet: Like the shelling of cities, the seemingly pointless, close-up killing of individuals recalls wars in Chechnya. Do they reflect intent, or only indifference, propaganda and a military culture of violence?
articles.abstract: Like the shelling of cities, the seemingly pointless, close-up killing of individuals recalls wars in Chechnya. Do they reflect intent, or only indifference, propaganda and a military culture of violence?
articles.lead_paragraph: In a photograph from the Kyiv suburb of Bucha, Ukraine, a woman stands in the yard of a house, her hand covering her mouth in horror, the bodies of three dead civilians scattered before her. When Aset Chad saw that picture, she started shaking and hurtled 22 years back in time.

articles.headline: China’s Economic Trends Hint at Cost of Zero Covid Strategy
articles.snippet: The country’s lockdowns have trapped truck drivers on highways, halted production lines and forced some importers to source goods from outside China.
articles.abstract: The country’s lockdowns have trapped truck drivers on highways, halted production lines and forced some importers to source goods from outside China.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Faced with its worst Covid-19 outbreak yet, China has been enforcing an expanding number of mass quarantines, strict lockdowns and border controls. The measures may yet work, but official data released on Monday show they are exacting a grim toll on the world’s second-largest economy.

articles.headline: Jim Farley Tries to Reinvent Ford and Catch Up to Elon Musk and Tesla
articles.snippet: Ford’s chief executive is about to introduce an electric F-150 pickup truck that could determine whether the automaker can survive and thrive in an industry dominated by Tesla.
articles.abstract: Ford’s chief executive is about to introduce an electric F-150 pickup truck that could determine whether the automaker can survive and thrive in an industry dominated by Tesla.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a recent Tuesday afternoon, Jim Farley, the chief executive of Ford Motor, took a spin in what could become one of the most important vehicles in the company’s 118-year history: an electric F-150 pickup truck.

articles.headline: A Rising Tally of Lonely Deaths on the Streets
articles.snippet: More than ever it has become deadly to be homeless in America, especially for men in their 50s and 60s.
articles.abstract: More than ever it has become deadly to be homeless in America, especially for men in their 50s and 60s.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: The Next Hurdle in Europe’s Energy Transition: Being More Enticing Than NFTs
articles.snippet: Financing the next generation of green energy technologies means larger investments and getting venture capitalists to turn their attention away from “fast money.”
articles.abstract: Financing the next generation of green energy technologies means larger investments and getting venture capitalists to turn their attention away from “fast money.”
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — When Jakob Bitner was 7, he left Russia for Germany with his parents and sister. Twenty-eight years later, he is set on solving a vexing green-energy problem that could help Germany end its dependence on imported energy from Russia, or anywhere.
articles.byline: By Eshe Nelson and Adam Satariano

articles.headline: How a Dollar General Employee Went Viral on TikTok
articles.snippet: Mary Gundel loved managing a store in Tampa, Fla. But when she detailed its challenges on social media, the company — and fellow employees — took notice.
articles.abstract: Mary Gundel loved managing a store in Tampa, Fla. But when she detailed its challenges on social media, the company — and fellow employees — took notice.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: Bleak assessments of the Russian economy clash with Putin’s rosy claims.
articles.snippet: While Vladimir Putin boasts that Russia is holding up under Western sanctions, his central bank chief and the mayor of Moscow warned that the worst was yet to come.
articles.abstract: While Vladimir Putin boasts that Russia is holding up under Western sanctions, his central bank chief and the mayor of Moscow warned that the worst was yet to come.
articles.lead_paragraph: Russia’s central bank chief warned on Monday that the consequences of Western sanctions were only beginning to be felt, and Moscow’s mayor said that 200,000 jobs were at risk in the Russian capital alone, stark acknowledgments that undermined President Vladimir V. Putin’s contention that sanctions had failed to destabilize the Russian economy.
articles.byline: By Anton Troianovski and Patricia Cohen
